title: Is K-pop becoming less or more popular in the West? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think it’s coasting at the moment. The wave has been coming for a while, and I think when BTS blew up internationally, that was when it truly hit. Now the door’s open for other groups/idols to become mainstream. The BTS hype has hit its peak, as people globally have recognized their talent and success; they’re household names, not an interesting side note at award shows. I mean, did you see their appearance on Jimmy Fallon? They’re actually being taken seriously and respected now. Of course, now that we’re in a pandemic, I don’t think Kpop is going to do much for the next few months. I think the fans that exist will stay fans, but I don’t think more people will get into it in the West; they have much bigger concerns at the moment. My guess is Kpop is going to stay about where it is right now: recognized and (somewhat) respected as a genre of music with global fans. I don’t think it’s going to get any bigger, but I don’t think it’s going to lose popularity (especially with TikTok.) Cheers~!
